title: Jacques Brunel (rugby union) - Wikipedia
snippet: During the 1979–80 French Rugby Union Championship, Brunel played for Grenoble, where they made it to the Last 32 stage, but was beaten by Montferrand 10–3. In 1980, again Brunel only made it as far as the Last 32, with Carcassonne, being beaten by Béziers 29–6. In 1981, he returned to Auch, where he remained with the club until his retirement at the end of 1987–88 season. He started coaching immediately after he retired from playing rugby in 1988, where he became the head coach of Auch until 1995.

title: Cinq choses à savoir sur Jacques Brunel
snippet: Brunel a occupé cette fonction de 2001 à 2007. Avec les Bleus, il a réalisé deux fois le Grand Chelem dans le Tournoi des Six nations (2002, 2004) et a également gagné la compétition en 2006 et 2007.

title: France rugby coach: Who has led the men's team over the years? - Rugby World
snippet: At the 2019 Rugby World Cup, Brunel was in charge in name only, with Fabien Galthie present in the coach’s box for every game as the team exited in the quarter finals again. Read more: Who has captained the French men’s team over the years? ... In the modern era no coach has a lower win percentage than Guy Noves.

title: Jacques Brunel | Ultimate Rugby Players, News, Fixtures and Live Results
snippet: After Guy Noves sacking December 2017 Brunel was named as the France national coach. In round 4 of the 2018 Six Nations under Brunel, France defeated England for the first time since 2015, running out 22–16 victors, and had it not been because of a defeat to Wales (14–13) in the final round, France could have finished second. Brunel lead France to the Rugby World Cup in Japan where they reached the quarter-finals before being knocked out by Wales.
